review: It worked fine at first, but an update to Chromecast in December 2013 resulted in repeated 16003 error codes when trying to watch Netflix from a Galaxy tablet.  The problem only happens with Netflix.  Netflix says it's NOT their problem.  Google customer service says they know about the problem, but there's no permanent fix for it yet.There are many suggestions on various internet forums about the problem, but none of the recommended solutions work for more than a session or two.  After that, you have to do a factory reset on CC or reinstall the Netflix app on your Android device to watch Netflix.It's really a disappointment.  It worked so nicely at first, but now it's pretty much useless.UPDATE:  There's a workaround for the problem.Start a Netflix movie on your tablet WITHOUT casting to Chromecast. After the movie has started on your tablet, click the Chromecast icon to watch it on your TV.  Once a movie is playing on the TV, you can switch to another movie, too.

review: I bought the chromecast from best buy. When i got home, i followed the whole set up steps with no issues. (This is the important part) in order for my router (belkin 334) to recognise my chromecast, i had to call in the belkin support team so that they could help me change some settings that would allow the router to see chromecast. It took a while but finally i was able to set everything up and cast netflix. After a few weeks of successfully casting, my computer started having a problem connecting to my network, it was also not finding the chromecast. I contacted the chromecast support team and their troubleshooting was not working. I called the belkin router people and they said i had to reset my router. Once i reset, everything worked. But problem is ... This is a repetitive problem....my device (chromecast) is always missing, my computer cannot detect it and sometimes my computer will not even connect to the internet. So i have to Reset Reset Reset... I have a feeling my router will disfunction one of this fine days. Thats my truth.
author: Kashizzle

review: I really like my new Chromecast, and not just because I'm a Google Fangirl, either.  I love that I can stream Youtube videos and Playlists.  Casting from my computer is a little choppy but I believe that is due to it being on the wireless network and a little on the old side.  I suspect it would be better if it were hardwired to the router.  And unlike my other device I can watch Netflix under my own user name and don't mess up everyone elses recommendations.  If only I could watch my Amazon account I could move my other devise to another TV and expand the goodness.All in all, I would recommend a Chromecast to anyone looking to expand their entertainment choices.  You can't beat the price.
author: Nila Repard

review: This is a great idea for streaming media player on big TV, but there is a huge problem with the software and connection.
